storyInfo: Soon after the end of the war, Vina determinedly takes up the mantle of Speaker to protect Londinium's citizens, no matter what the dukes demand of her. In the presence, another name is causing her headache: Millscar.

attributes.content: <p=1>Palace of Westhaleg</><p=2>October 8th, 1098, 7:28 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Shortly after the war
This was a resplendent place twenty-six years ago.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: At the time, the dome above was polished to a mirror sheen, and the radiance of the twin moons and the enchanting darkness of the starry sky dancing together was a most beauteous sight.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Once, I kissed the back of His Majesty's hand here. 'Paying respects to King Alistair', a rare honor indeed.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Victoria no longer has a king, my Ladyâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Or should I call you the Earl of March?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Just Eleanor is fine.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: I did not beg His Grace the Duke of Normandy for the seat of County March to hold the title of Earl, but rather to expedite a few business matters, Your Highness.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: If it were not for that farcical royal hanging, we might have been much closer, Vina.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: She takes out a gilded purple business card, its face embossed with nothing more than a golden loosestrife flower.
Please, take it. Since you're more accustomed to do things in a businesslike manner, this might put you at ease.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: I'm afraid we are not so well-acquainted. Do you all always decide the future of Londinium here, my Lady?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It was never up to me where we meet. Besides, considering all that's happened here, surely there is nowhere else more suited than this?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Eleanor looks at the faded statues and dusty doors at the end of the hallway, as if she could capture their past glory.
In the room beyond was the King of Victoria's throne. Upon it he once sat, dictating the rise and fall of the Empire.
But what remains behind those doors now?
I arrived early to both walk down memory lane and to meet with you. We have much to talk about.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Did you not wish to meet me too?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: You know I'm holding aâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina, surely your friends from Rhodes Island have divulged what the other dukes are thinking to you.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: The other dukes? I don't see much difference between you, them and the Duke of Normandy backing you.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Oh, don't get me mixed up with His Grace. He's a man worthy of respect, but it's not worth bothering him with trifles such as handling Londinium.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: As for the rest of them, I dare not say I'm worthy of comparison.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: The Sarkaz withdrawal does not mean that Londinium's troubles are over. None are willing to tally up the change in the Infected population, but the outcome is rather clear.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Victoria's pharmaceutical production lines are insufficient, and nobody wants to rework their precious factories for the sake of the Infected. You know what I mean.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I have a long-standing partnership with the Columbian military. They've even referred me to several pharmaceutical companies.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: There is no crack that cannot be plugged. For the right price, of course.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Is that a threat?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Only if you think it is. Don't be too hasty to respond. Figure out what bargaining chips you have first before you come find me, Vina.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Let's start our future partnership on the right foot.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Oh, and, you know you can tell just by looking around that your family once steered the course of all Victoria from this ancient palace.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Your Royal Highness Alexandrina, Londinium is far too small for youâ€”
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: The city's far too large, if you ask me. It shames me to admit, but the wailing I heard all across Londinium had me quaking in my boots, and in my panic, I went the wrong way.
Ah, so many tragic sights in this city...
You really have grown, Ellie. I still remember how you used to clamber up my back and grab onto my antlers.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: I am ever grateful for your generosity. His Grace the Duke of Normandy also reminded me that he is off soon to convalesce in greener pastures. You may join him, if you wish.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Hah, I'm not one to leave my manor before I've drained my wine cellar dry of the fine vintages within.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: And here I was thinking old Normandy would understand the importance of this little meeting of ours.
But no matter. You are the reason we have gathered here today, Alexandrina.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: *cough* Your Grace didn't need to cut to the chase quite so quickly.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: The old soldier's running late... Did he refuse your invitation again?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: He turned his eyes away from Londinium a long time ago. I'm sure your spies will have all the details of my meeting with him served to you with breakfast tomorrow.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yet even now, his elegance is no less impressive than the time Gaul was swallowed whole.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I wouldn't consider this a good thing for Victoria.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Tara and Dublinn... Though he has not explicitly declared independence from Victoria, only the blind fail to see the reality of the situation.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Abercorn and Fife suffered tremendous losses, and so have 'forfeited the right' to take part in the big decisions. And the one behind Ashworth has decided to stay far from any sort of turmoil.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: As for Normandy... His stance is rather clear-cut.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Gododdin smiles at the Young Duke. Eleanor simply performs the most minute of bows in return.
Aye, the vagaries of life.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Back in those days, we still held parliamentary banquets here, and King Alistair still sat in the throne room. None would take his words lightly.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: In the dark and dusty hall, Duke Gododdin lithely taps out a beat etched in his memories with one foot, just like in days past.

Smoke, music, and the sunlight shined upon him from the dome above. He was a spirited young man back then, with all the lords and ladies at the feast lined up to be his dance partner. Even His Majesty applauded him.
Then, together with the other dukes, he sent the King to the gallows.
No need to memorialize the dead, Your Grace. His orphan stands before us, does she not?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Hah, aye, so she does. What does it matter if Victoria has no king?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: The Siege. That's all I can call you until you accept our proposal.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: There are better ways to implement your ideas on the Infected, the refugees, even those pain-in-the-arse Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: ...Madam Speaker.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Should I consider this advice from the 'will of the empire'?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Call it an attempt at giving some. We have other means to handle this near-ruined city.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: This is not a lifetime appointment. We will judge whether or not you are fit for the position.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Just like the past, no?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: With your 'dinner table Parliament', a handful of dukes could dance around the King behind closed doors, deciding the nation's future on a whim.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And the results? Look outside. We have not yet washed ourselves clean of all the Sarkaz bloodâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You look only at this little city, while I look at the whole of Victoria.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: If Londinium has become an ulcer sapping Victoria's strength, I do not mind gouging it out.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I will allow other nations to see Victoria bleed, but I will not tolerate them mocking our scars, nauseating though they may be.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: If you stand in a sewer, you cannot expect to have full view of an ancient empire. Do not forget that the family name 'Victoria' is no stranger to me, Your Royal Highness Alexandrina.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Only the strong and the heroic have the power to steer the empire on its future course.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Let's not frighten our future friend, Your Grace. Didn't we gather here to soothe our worries in a more pleasant manner?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Old Wellington is far from the core, Windermere is in a constant state of uproar, and the rest are keeping an eye on how we stand.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Since it's rare for us all to see eye-to-eye on a matter, let's keep things simple.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: That, I cannot deny. But Vina, you can do far more than this.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Though this does not mean the Speaker must sit on the throne, Ellie.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Are you all finished?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She draws her sword, and the hall falls deathly silent.

attributes.text: Vina insisted on recording some minutes for that secret meeting.
\nIt was a meeting to decide Londinium's future, so her residents had the right to know what happened exactly.

I stood there in my hiding spot, trying to note down every word as impartially as I could, but when I saw Vina draw that sword from her hip, pointing it at those bastards who thought they knew it all...
\nI hoped from my deepest heart that she would strike them all down. That way, what came next might have gone differently.

attributes.content: My teacher once told me the Sighs of Kings was used to behead rebellious noblesâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No, not the Sighs of Kings any longer, though I do not know what to call it now.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I have not the right to name it, as it was the workers who forged it. To commemorate that victory, whose painful sting has not yet left us.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: At first, as it lay forgotten upon the muddy battlefield, I thought its duty had ended.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But those heroes who lost everything still remember it, because it symbolizes the Victoria held in their hearts. They do not wish to see her laden with dust once more.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I know what they intended when they gave it to me. They wanted me to judge in their stead... Judge those who brought them to desolation and ruin.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But you don't fear it, do you?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It was never the sword you feared.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina gently caresses the flourishes on both sides of the sword's crossguard, every detail sculpted by the artisans of Londinium.
A hammer and a sword. They glimmer in the darkness.
'So long as the sword gleams, Victoria's honor will shine eternal.'
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They begged my aid in reforging this sword, broken to the point of no return... using my hammer as its core.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Once reforged, they offered it to me without hesitation. But at the time, I could make no promises. King? Speaker? As far as I'm concerned...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Neither title is worth a damn. I'm no different from them. I'm just a woman who wanted to go home.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And when I made it back, what did I find?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I didn't see the 'grand' Victoria you do.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But I did see Infected children in the boxing gym, hoping to learn pugilism so they could defend their homes. And drunkards, mouths full of rotting teeth, donating the drinks they had stashed away to the hospitals, all so soldiers on the operating table could be saved.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The glory of empire has long since left us, so far in the distance it can no longer warm our hard beds in the winter chill of the new year.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: This sword is the duty they entrusted to me. I need neither Parliament nor royal authority to know what I must do.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I will do what I can to show them the power they hold in their hands. To make them understand the land is theirs to protect!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But until that day comes, I must stand at their forefront, no matter what title I bear.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Sewers too, may bloom. And so, here, in my home...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I will NOT be lectured by the likes of you!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina firmly plants the sword into the ground, its point passing through the stone like butter. It stands tall before the dukes.
All eyes fall upon the quivering sword. A very clear provocation from Vina.
'Realmblade' and 'miracle'. In the wake of the war, those two words have become joined at the hip.
Rather than 'the late king's orphan', they are much more concerned about Vina's other identity.
Hah, well said, my Lady! There's really no point in us keeping the sword nowadays.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Best you pull it right out, no point in nicking such a fine blade.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Your teacher really did give you a practical education. It seems we were worried over nothing, Duke Caster.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Indeed. A rather childish way of doing things, but one that will win over the people. Parliament will see her mature faster than ever.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Wait just a bloody minuteâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We have no choice, Siege. Sundered Victoria needs a new voice, and you have stepped forward.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: But I have seen many die by their own blades, leading me to think long and hard about taking up that particular one.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Do not let it cut you, Madam Speaker. That is my advice.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.options: She's more clear-headed than Your Graces think.;I'd say you've done pretty well so far, Vina.

attributes.content: Doctor?!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Pardon me, Your Grace. We were... unable to stop the Doctor.
attributes.name: Trilby Asher

attributes.content: (Bored growl)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You are dismissed.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.options: Londinium needs a leader who can protect everyone.
You cannot rely on anyone else.

attributes.content: Doctor...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: The final decision is yours, naturally.;We will do everything we can to help the Infected here.

attributes.content: How interesting. A pharmaceutical company specialized in Oripathy that often dips its toe into areas outside its expertise.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: You circumvented the ducal alliance, and tendered a ceasefire with those Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.options: Well, there was no reaction from Your Graces' fleets.;You assented to it, did you not?

attributes.content: Merely a gift, as thanks for all you have done on the battlefield.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: There are some lines that must not be crossed.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: We will await your answer, Siege.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: As for Rhodes Island, you lot have been keeping quiet for a while now. Why the sudden urgency?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.options: Time itself makes for irrational decisions.

attributes.content: Oh? Time, is it...?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Vina, have a good think about what the people you're still protecting really need.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: And remember, if you do make your decision, don't get too close with those Rhodes Islanders.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.options: I believe we have a good relationship with Duke of Normandy, my Lady.

attributes.content: That's exactly why I'm warning Vina, 'Doctor' of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: She's not quite like the other dukes.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: So, what should we do now, Doctor?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: You already have your answer, don't you, Vina?;It's not good for Rhodes to get more involved in Londinium's affairs.
Amiya's already left for Kazdel.;Most of our staff... will withdraw from Londinium ASAP.

attributes.content: <p=1>The Sineselde, Parliamentary Chamber</><p=2>December 8th, 1098, 5:01 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: It's been a long time since Babel took my brothers away. As for us who stayed, it's been real rough lately.
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: Hmph. Just do it already. I've got nothing else to say.
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: He looks all around him, watching the people on their benches whisper to one another uneasily, an unconscious sneer on his face.
This place fettered him, and in its magnanimity, it had also fettered those who would decide his fate.
Not too long ago, Vina vetoed a proposal to use the Palace of Westhaleg to house the Parliament, instead choosing this building oft rented out by the royal family.
She hoped this would be the starting point of a new Parliament.
I've finished looking into him, Vina.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Longshot, a lifelong mercenary, hails from a place in Kazdel called the Scar Market. During the war, he took part in defending the city in the name of the Military Commission. He never saw the front lines.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Two months ago, Babel organized a withdrawal effort. He didn't follow them. Instead, he got captured by Indra and Dagda while covering for some local Sarkaz as they evacuated. You really did save him.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I... don't remember that.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: After he committed this latest crime of his, we followed his trail and found the people he was hiding.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: His daughter has been helping a few Sarkaz leave the city these past two months. But this time she's part of the group sneaking out herself.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*!
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: You attacked the shopkeep who recognized you for supplies, didn't you?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Aaaaaghhhâ€”
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: Restrain him!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Don't lose your temper just yet, Longshot. Your loved ones managed to slip through our fingers. Someone's helping them.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Millscar. Sounds familiar, right?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Their 'business' is creeping into places they shouldn't be creeping into.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: ...Hah. Haha.
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: I don't know a damned thing, Feline. Just kill me already.
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: Worried my blood's going to get this pretty little place all dirty?
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: The war's just ended, and you're already trembling at the sight of some red?!
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: None of you sitting here have even one-tenth of the honesty of those Sarkaz you refuse to call Victorians!
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: Just leave the rest to me.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Any new instructions from Her Grace on the latest going-ons in the city?
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: Her Grace has long since been aware of the trouble these Sarkaz and this Millscar have been causing, and she is very concerned about the safety of the citizens.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: But now Parliament is fully assembled, and since the Speaker has been doing a fine job of solving the issues plaguing the citizenry, she believes things will improve.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: However...
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: However?
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: When it comes to rooting out the risks against Londinium's safety, Her Grace is of the opinion that we should not tarry, especially in regards to Millscar.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: And so, there are still problems in this city that we must urge the Speaker to resolve sooner rather than later.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: <p=1>Millscar Hideout</><p=2>December 8th, 1098, 6:05 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Boss, Parliament hanged that devil, but we managed to snag the stuff he left for us.
attributes.name: Impatient Mercenary

attributes.content: These goods...
attributes.name: Impatient Mercenary

attributes.content: Send them out.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: But boss... That's way too risky right now. Parliament's been trying to sniff us out 24/7.
attributes.name: Impatient Mercenary

attributes.content: Then hide them for a spell. They've paid their due, so we'll get them delivered. No need to worry about anything else.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Nobody knows about this batch anyway, maybe we can justâ€”
attributes.name: Impatient Mercenary

attributes.content: The mercenary gestures at his neck, but a sharp pain accompanied by a chill suddenly prickles at his chin.
B-Boss, I had to say it, even if you kill me! That's the best way to handle things!
attributes.name: Impatient Mercenary

attributes.content: Didn't those devils kill a whole bunch of our people?!
attributes.name: Impatient Mercenary

attributes.content: If you really cared, you'd be on the Exemplars' list of decommissioned soldiers, not here.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: But there's nothing wrong with caution, I suppose. With the new Speaker so concerned about the city's safety, we're an inevitable target alongside the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Hmph. Those devils brought it upon themselves, though.
attributes.name: Impatient Mercenary

attributes.content: Two months ago, they decided not to withdraw alongside the rest of their kin. Now that things are heading south for them and they finally wish to flee, it's natural they have to pay extra.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Don't worry. If this goes well, more and more business opportunities will be coming our way.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You're back. How'd it go? Did you manage to get any?
attributes.name: Discharged Female Soldier

attributes.content: Sanatorium's as full as a tin of fins. Everyone's trying to get their suppressant as soon as they can, not to mention what just happened to Madam Major...
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: Sorry, Diane. Not even Exemplars get special treatment.
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: Rhodes Island's been working around the clock to provide as many suppressants as they can, but there's just too many new Infectedâ€”
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: I... I understand.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Hmm... Well, it's not like we've got no way of getting any. I've heard from some war buddies that there's private channels...
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: Illegal ones?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Hey, as long as you live to see another dayâ€”
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: There's other means of buying medicine? Huh. My boss never told me we'd have competitors.
Hmph. Sure you didn't hear me wrong, mister?
attributes.name: Injured Exemplar

attributes.content: Ah, sorry, my trip from Columbia must have tired me out too much. Hello, I'm Eliseo. Here, my business card.
Colum...bia? Pure Heart Medical?
attributes.name: Diane
Eliseo
attributes.content: That's right, I rushed over to Victoria to find... to find...

attributes.name: Eliseo
attributes.content: Err, one second, let me check my list...
Ever since I arrived in Londinium, nearly everything's been different to how the preliminary briefing described it.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Found it. Londinium's interim health secretary... Madam Major. Could you tell me how to get to the Office of Provisional Supply Procurement?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Rest assured, I'm here representing Pure Heart Medical to discuss medical cooperation. The situation here will get better soon.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Did I... say something wrong?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Didn't you hear the news? Madam Major has... passed away. Just this morning.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Sorry.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Sorry, I lost my cool for a second. No matter how hard we must strive, Pure Heart Medical's sincerity and dedication will not change.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: But right now, could you please take me to her office?
attributes.name: Eliseo
